subject: G-Men Win Another
event:
I was nervous about this Ravens game.  Maybe I was having flashbacks to the Giants/ Ravens Superbowl.

Turns out my fears were misplaced.  A convincing win for the G-Men.

Their schedule is horrendous the rest of the way, not a single game against a team with a losing record, but I think they're equal to it.  Their three-headed running back is monstrous.

comments.article: Go Titans (Sorry, at 10-0, I can't not).

Wouldn't it be great if the Giants beat another 18-0 team?
It's early I know. Hopefully both the Giants and the Titans meet in the Superbowl.
But the Falcons lost. The world is sad and gray.

Congratulations on your team winning , I must confess I have no idea about this sport but it seems to be the most popular this side of the globe.

I hope that you are doing wel and your writing is going on great. Congrats on HBO PILOT episode, hopefully we"ll see the world of westeros soon. I recently met another Santa Fe resident author Mr.David Morell who told me that he was writng about the French Foreign Legion & a certain object in your Warrior anthology.

He had some really gr8 things to say about it and you Sir. Anyways it would be really nice if you talk a little something about ASOIAF over here too Sir, I know of the recent fan problems you had but it still might be nice if you just drop in a comment about the intriguing world you have created for the rest of us who look forward to your thoughts over here.

Thank you for you books and keep writing
Is that typo a result of the fact that deep down you are a closet Raider fan?

I was cheering for the Ravens since, as a Pats fan, I'm required to hate the Giants, but the first thing I thought when the Giants scored that last touchdown was:

"GRRM will be happy, anyway."

Speak for yourself. We're required to hate the Jets, not the Giants. As bad as the loss in the Superbowl was last year, it was a hell of a game and a great time watching it with both Pats and Giants fans in the room (I had roommates from New York). I want to see Pats vs. Giants in the Superbowl again. Am I the only person NOT worried about the Titans?

Also, this is somewhat off-topic and kind of late, but does anyone else agree that Eli Manning is actually surprisingly funny in his commercials? My favorite one was the one for ESPN's NFL Sunday Countdown show when he is asked about that Olympic runner trying out to play in the NFL and Eli responds, "He runs like my brother runs for endorsement opportunities." Haha, I wouldn't mind seeing Peyton return with a friendly little jab of his own.
Three headed running back, has Qyburn been awarded a position on the Giants' medical staff?
comments.subject: three headed runningback?

comments.article: Surely not as monstrous as the Mountain?

What is UP with the Giants? They keep quietly winning game after game and yet, besides Manning, (and Burress who isn't playing(?)) I can't name a single super star.
Weird.

Well, my boys are 7-3 W00T! So I'm happy.
Ever hear of Justin Tuck??? Only a leading candidate for Defensive Player of the Year...

Wasn't nervous, but Wow! Wasn't expecting the stampede. Hopefully Jacobs's knee will recover fully. The backs were great but the nod goes to the O-line and receivers who stay in the play and block. This coaching staff is something else. Although to nitpick, I felt that Carney not playing was over-thinking. Eh, it's not even worth discussing.
Take some time out from writing tomorrow night and spare a thought for this poor Bills fan who will be sitting in the snow to watch the most boring team in football.
Yeah, and that Monday Nighter was a particularly brutal way to lose.

I grew up in Maryland, and I'm here to tell you...

RAVENS GOIN' DOWN

Giants are totally takin' it to the superbowl this year :)

My team (Panthers) won today, too... yaaaay ^^

Two teams based on huge scary dudes, two teams that win with smart passing, incredible running (with the O-line necessary), and a stingy defense.

I don't see any reason these two teams shouldn't meet for a real bruising Super Bowl.
comments.subject: Titans/Giants

comments.article: because, though certainly not unheard of, it is rare that the two teams that "should" make to the Big Dance, actually do. Which is why most of the Big Dances are so lopsided.
comments.subject: Re: Titans/Giants

comments.article:
For the Giants to run the ball the way they did against the Ravens says a lot about their team. The Ravens are tough, and yet the G-Men beat them down today. Again, hats off! Also, since I forgot to comment on Friday's blog, I will use this opportunity to second your cheer of J-E-T-S, Jets! Jets! Jets! I've never followed the Jets that closely but with Favre there now and them having a chance to take out the hated Patriots I am officially on their bandwagon in the AFC.

In the NFC, of course, I am thrilled that Dallas beat Washington tonight. I was on the edge of my seat and nervous as hell the entire game, and it felt so good to keep hope alive with this win, not to mention how good it always feels to beat Washington, especially on their own field. It's going to be a tough road to the playoffs and the division itself is almost certainly going to the Giants but...anything is possible in this league. All the talk was about Romo and his pinky all week, but Terrence Newman being back was absolutely huge for the Boys! All I can say is "Whew!"
comments.subject: And we're both happy!

comments.article:
Double Whew!

Yeah, hopefully now that Romo is back, the Cowboys can start clicking again and make life a little happier for the fans by not only getting to the playoffs but getting past the first round.

I'm also starting to have hopes for the Titans since I was born and raised in the Houston area... but I'm also cognizant of the Oiler tradition of achieving great heights to only make the fall that much more of a spectacle. With one exception of being a foot short of a superbowl win.

A Cowboy v. Titan Superbowl would be simply awesome imo.
comments.subject: Re: And we're both happy!

comments.article: It is under fire that true men's colors will shine most bright,
Mike Carlsen, our wonderous pundit on channel 5 in the UK has tipped the Giants to get to the Superbowl.

The Giants are definitely looking like contenders.

The Dolphins ... not so much. Two weeks of barely winning is kind of scary going into the game against the Pats. I fear it's going to be disaster. *crosses fingers*
giants runnning game + no Eli picks/ INTs = awesomeness.

I have Brandon Jacobs and Thomas Jones for my starting backs in fantasy this year so you go George!

Alex
comments.subject: G-Men/Jets

comments.article: the giants do look pretty dominant.  the ESPN analysts are calling them Earth Wind and Fire.Jacobs obviously Earth, I think Bradshaw is probably wind, leaving Ward to be fire.
comments.subject: running attack

comments.article: I will readily admit it... that is a very good football team you have up there in "New York"  The Ravens were downright embarrassing at times, and while some of it was the always impressive ability of the Ravens to self destruct in truly spectacular fashion, a lot of it was getting outplayed by a very, very good football team.  And we hung with the Titans, so I like the Giants chances if it comes down to those two come Super Bowl time.

You know what's funny? Every game the Giants play from here on in is against either a division leader (or co-leader) or a division rival -- and their last three were, too (DAL, PHI, co-leader BAL). And they could easily -- well, not *easily*, but very plausibly -- end it 14-2.

Here's hoping for Titans-Giants, which will be mammoth.

AP is the god by which all football players should be judged. Go Vikes! Die Bears and Pack! Now that I've made my prerequisite football comment.....goeorge if u read this can u answer me this? the pilot kicks ass the series is picked up for all seven seasons. does george get back into tv writing a bit? do you see yourself doing a little writing on the show? and plz take care of yourself george i fear for your saftey like an overprotective mother. damnit man its gonna be a masterpiece! finish it!1
How about the Giants/Ravens? :P
comments.subject: Giants/Raiders . . . ?

comments.article:
In regards to your LA comment on the last post, the problem with LA is that we are a bunch of sports fans relocated for job purposes to a town lacking love for the home team. I always enjoy an energized match between any two real competitors as do many Los Angelinos' I've chatted up. But our loyalties lie with our own home-teams. Mine, sadly to say is that of the Lions. 0-10. I'm able to counter with the Pistons or my favorite - the Red Wings but I do enjoy watching football most. Barry football of the 90's but we can't live in the past.
LA has no home love. Kobe this Kobe that. Dodgers can't buy a World Series. And Kings?... riiiight. And of course there's either the Raiders forever losing under crazy Al or the Chargers and LT "gee I wonder where the ball is going this down?" We'll never be a football town. The Colleseum of USC is horrid and Pasadena will forever vote against having back to back football days - UCLA and sunday NFL. Staples center has 19 pro teams already vying for space. So that's my rant from Hollywoodland. I'll root for 0-11 this weekend as I watch some other team get upset over shifty calls.
comments.subject: A thought on LA sports
